etymologies: late 16th century; earliest use found in Henry Howard (1540–1614), courtier, administrator, and author. From birth + night, after birthday

definitions: The night on which a person was born.
The night on which something began or came into existence, or on which an event occurred.
The anniversary of the night on which a person was born; the evening or night of a person's birthday, typically regarded as an occasion for celebration and the giving of gifts.
